frontmatter.title: Use OAuth 2.0
frontmatter.description: Understand how to implement OAuth 2.0 authentication and authorization flows, including login, logout, and setup examples.

questions.question: What redirect URI should I use?
How do I add OAuth permissions to manifest?
questions.answer: Add hostnames to permissions.oauth array like `["login.microsoftonline.com", "www.dropbox.com"]`.

questions.question: How do I start OAuth authorization?
questions.answer: Call `addOnUISdk.app.oauth.authorize()` with authorizationUrl, clientId, scope, and codeChallenge.

questions.question: What does the authorize method return?
questions.answer: Returns object with id, code, redirectUri, and result containing status and description.

questions.question: How do I generate access tokens?
questions.answer: Use the authorization code with token exchange endpoint and code verifier from PKCE flow.

questions.question: Should tokens persist across sessions?
questions.answer: Yes, store tokens locally or remotely so users don't re-authenticate every session.

questions.question: What helper utilities are available?
questions.answer: OAuthUtils.js module provides generateChallenge(), generateAccessToken(), and getAccessToken() functions.

questions.question: What are common OAuth use cases?
questions.answer: Cloud storage access, user authentication, premium features, and personalized account data sync.
